edu.cpp.cs.cs141.finalProject

Class Player

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.cpp.cs.cs141.finalProject.Character
      • edu.cpp.cs.cs141.finalProject.Player
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class Player
extends Character
    This class represents the Player of the game. Additionally, this class extends the Character class. The player will initially start out in the bottom left of the board, with a gun which has one bullet. The player will also be given 3 lives to start out.
    Author:
    Richard Pham, Oakar Kyaw, Ethan Liao, Jeremy Anunwah, Bennett Wong.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Field Detail

      • playerGun

        private Gun playerGun
        This field represents the player's gun. The player's gun will initially have one bullet.

      • lives

        private int lives
        This field represents the amount of lives the player has. Once the player's lives runs to zero, the game will be over.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Player

        public Player(int row,
              int column)
        This constructor will take in a desired row position and a column position. With these two parameters, it will set the player's position to the parameters.
        Parameters:
        row - the desired row position of the player.
        column - the desired column position of the player.

    • Method Detail

      • setLives

        public void setLives(int lives)
        This method will set the lives to the parameter.
        Parameters:
        lives - the desired amount of lives to set the lives of the player to.

      • getLives

        public int getLives()
        This method returns the amount of lives the player has.
        Returns:
        amount of lives the player has

      • shoot

        public boolean shoot()
        This method is called when the player decides to use his or her gun to shoot. If the player has ammo in his or her gun, then then the method will return true. Otherwise, the method will return false.
        Returns:
        whetehr or not the player successfully shot his or her gun

      • getAmmo

        public int getAmmo()
        This method returns the amount ammo in the player's gun.
        Returns:
        the amount of ammo in the player's gun.

      • setAmmo

        public void setAmmo(int bullet)
        This method sets the amount of ammo in the player's gun to whatever is passed into the parameter.
        Parameters:
        bullet - the amount of ammo to set the player's gun to

      • resetPosition

        public void resetPosition()
        This method will set the position of the player to be back to the original position.
